PO.question: PO05: Which of the following are necessary for the PO to maximize the value delivered by the MVP (select all that apply)?
PO.answerOptions:
A. Scrum team velocity
B. Unit test results
C. User feedback
D. Product vision

PO.question: PO06: When can the Scrum team interact with stakeholders (select one)?
PO.answerOptions:
"A. Sprint Review
B. Sprint Retrospective
C. Any time it will help deliver value
D. Daily standup"

PO.question: PO07: What is the role of the PO during the Daily Standup (select one)?
PO.answerOptions:
A. Assign tasks to Developers
B. Monitor the performance of the Scrum Master
C. The PO doesn’t generally participate in the Daily Standup
D. Review Backlog items with the team

PO.question: PO08: Values are only assumptions until they are validated by users (select one)
PO09: Sprint durations may be modified when (select one)
PO.answerOptions:
A. A member of the development team leaves the project
B. Requested by a stakeholder
C. A key milestone is missed
D. The sprint duration may not be changed once the project is underway

PO.question: PO10: Which of the following are common attributes of a Backlog item (select one)?
PO.answerOptions:
A. Complexity, agility, openness, commitment
B. Description, order, size
C. Commitment, courage, openness, respect, focus
D. Velocity, risk, ownership

PO.question: PO11: How should a PO respond when Developers ask for clarification about a Backlog item (select one)?
PO.answerOptions:
A. The PO should provided the necessary information or enable the Developers to find it themselves
B. The PO should defer to the SM to answer the question
C. The PO should instruct the Developers to find the answer themselves
D. The PO should wait until the next Sprint Planning session to provide the information

PO.question: PO12: What is Product Backlog grooming (select one)?
PO.answerOptions:
A. An old name for Product Backlog refinement
B. A Scrum event
C. A type of backlog refinement only used in software development projects
D. Rewriting Product Backlog items to make them easier to understand

PO.question: PO13: Sprints are a technique to limit work in progress (select one)
PO14: What action should the PO take in the middle of a Sprint when the Developers provide feedback that they will be unable to finish items in the Sprint Backlog (select one)?
PO.answerOptions:
A. Punish the Developers for poorly estimating the work required
B. Cancel the Sprint
C. Adapt the planned scope so the Sprint Goal might still be accomplished
D. Immediately report this to Management

PO.question: PO15: Who can add items to the Product Backlog (select one)?
PO.answerOptions:
A. The PO and Developers
B. The Scrum Master
C. The Developers
D. Anyone, but the PO remains accountable for the Product Backlog

PO.question: PO16: A PBI is (select one)?
PO.answerOptions:
A. Project Backlog Item
B. Product Backlog Item
C. Priority Backlog Item
D. Project Backlog Indicator

PO.question: PO17: Which team member is responsible for managing the Sprint Backlog (select one)?
PO.answerOptions:
A. The PO
B. The SM
C. The Developers
D: Any stake

PO.question: PO18: The PO is the creator and owner of the definition of done (select one)

SM.question: SM05: What is the primary role of a Scrum Master?
SM.answerOptions:
A. To manage the team
B. To remove obstacles for the team
C. To assign tasks to team members
D. To report progress to stakeholders

SM.question: SM06: Who is responsible for managing the Product Backlog?
SM.answerOptions:
A. The Scrum Master
B. The Development Team
C. The Product Owner
D. The Stakeholders

SM.question: SM07: What is the time-box for a Daily Scrum?
SM.answerOptions:
A. 15 minutes
B. 30 minutes
C. 1 hour
D. As much time as needed for teammates to communicate all the details about their tasks

SM.question: SM08: Who determines the definition of “Done”?
SM.answerOptions:
A. The Scrum Master
B. The Product Owner
C. The Development Team
D. The Stakeholders

SM.question: SM09: What is the maximum length of a Sprint?
SM.answerOptions:
A. 1 week
B. 2 weeks
C. 1 month
D. There is no maximum length

SM.question: SM10: Who has the authority to cancel a Sprint?
SM.answerOptions:
A. The Scrum Master
B. The Development Team
C. The Product Owner
D. The Stakeholders

SM.question: SM11: What is the main reason for the Scrum Master to be at the Daily Scrum?
SM.answerOptions:
A. To write a status report
B. To keep the Development Team on track
C. To facilitate the meeting if necessary
D. To update the Product Backlog

SM.question: SM12: What is the outcome of a Sprint?
SM.answerOptions:
A. A potentially shippable product increment
B. A complete product
C. A list of completed tasks
D. A list of requirements for the next Sprint

SM.question: SM13: What is the role of the Product Owner during a Sprint?
SM.answerOptions:
A. To manage the Development Team
B. To clarify the Product Backlog items and accept completed tasks
C. To remove obstacles for the team
D. To report progress to stakeholders

SM.question: SM14: Who can change the Sprint Backlog during a Sprint?
SM.answerOptions:
A. Only the Scrum Master
B. Only the Product Owner
C. Only the Development Team
D. Both the Scrum Master and the Product Owner

SM.question: SM15: What is a Sprint?
SM.answerOptions:
A. A meeting to plan the product features
B. A set period of time during which specific work has to be completed and made ready for review
C. The list of product requirements and features
D. The team responsible for developing the product

SM.question: SM16: What happens when all planned work is completed early in a Sprint?
SM.answerOptions:
A. The team takes a break until the next Sprint
B. The team pulls more work from the Product Backlog
C. The Sprint is considered complete
D. The team starts the next Sprint early

SM.question: SM17: What is the main purpose of the Sprint Retrospective?
SM.answerOptions:
A. To reflect on the past Sprint and plan for improvements
B. To review the work done and not done
C. To demonstrate the work done to stakeholders
D. To plan the next Sprint

SM.question: SM18: Who attends the Sprint Retrospective?
SM.answerOptions:
A. The Scrum Master, the Product Owner, and the Development Team
B. The Scrum Master and the Development Team
C. The Scrum Master, the Product Owner, the Development Team, and the Stakeholders
D. The Scrum Master and the Product Owner

SM.question: SM19: The PO may delegate the responsibility for sizing a PBI to the SM (select one)
